intro: Astragalus macrocarpus subsp. lefkarensis, commonly known as the Lefkara milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Cyprus. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its subspecies status highlights its unique genetic and morphological traits compared to other Astragalus species.
